page.title: 07MELBURY RESERVOIR
page.content:
The reservoir at Melbury is part of the local network of reservoirs and is used to supplement Westward Ho!'s water supply when other reservoirs are getting low. The pressure on the water supplies is greater in the summer when there are large numbers of holiday makers in the North Devon area.
Around the reservoir there is a lot of forestry. In the spring you can sometimes see frogs spawn in one corner. Sometimes fishermen can be found fishing from the bank for trout. During the winter time a small number of ducks can be found on the lake and a pair of buzzards can be found in the area. Swallows, House Martins and Wagtails are common around the waterside and gulls (various) use the water for roosting.
